text:
Illegal characters in filenames
===

WINDOWS
---

< (less than)
> (greater than)
: (colon)
" (double quotation mark)
/ (forward slash)
\ (backslash)
| (pipe)
? (question mark)
* (asterisk)

^ (caret) is specifically forbidden under the FAT filesystem

Other rules: Filenames cannot end in a space or a period*  

 *pretty sure this is outdated w/r/t Windows 7 and newer; I have several files that end in periods, though I rename them whenever I find them because some apps do get confused trying to read them

MACOS X
---

: (colon)

Other rules: File and folder names cannot begin with a period* 

	*according to what I've read, but the existence of e.g. ~/.vim and ~/.vimrc on my system suggests that this is wrong, misleading, or outdated

UNIX/GNU/LINUX
---

/ (forward slash)
NUL (\0)
ASCII control characters 0-31 (not strictly illegal, but please do not use)
title: illegal characters for filenames
